law.catch_line: Legislative findings -- Development of summer learning program encouraged -- Purposes of program.

text.section: The General Assembly finds that economically advantaged and economically disadvantaged children make similar academic progress during a school year, but that it is during the summer months when disadvantaged students fall behind. It is the intent of the General Assembly to promote a program through which disadvantaged and low-achieving children maintain and improve the reading and mathematics skills they have developed during the school year.

law.history: Created 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 131, sec. 1, effective July 12, 2012.
